text.tspan: When mitering polygon offsets, the maximum distance the
offset point can be from its origin can be very large. So we
need to set a limit above which offsets will be 'squared'
instead of mitered. Consequently, we need to know when
mitered offsets will exceed an arbitrary limit.
For a given limit (λ) expressed as a multiple of the offset
delta (δ), at what angle ß will mitering exceed this limit?
And squaring both sides ... 1 – cos(Ø) = 2 / λ²
Example: if the miter limit (λ) = 2 (ie 2 × δ), then
So when ß > 120 deg. (or Ø < 60 deg.), offseting will
exceed the offset distance of 2 × δ and will require
